business.headline: Are mutual funds really the best place to invest your money right now?Headlines around the India–US trade deal, India–EU FTA, Budget 2026, sharp moves in gold and silver and a sudden sell-off in IT stocks have come in quick succession, and when so much happens at once, many investors fall into the trap of reacting to every market move.

India agreed to open agriculture, dairy sectors to US players? Piyush Goyal answersEarlier, Piyush Goyal shared the details of the deal that followed a framework interim trade agreement between the two countries, aimed at boosting exports, jobs and market access. The trade deal will formally be signed in March.

Reduced US tariffs of 18% on India come into effect. What it meansThe agreement will reduce US reciprocal duties on Indian exports to 18 per cent, while scrapping tariffs entirely on items such as generic medicines, gems and diamonds, and aircraft components—opening up stronger export prospects across several key sectors.

India-US trade deal to boost exports, safeguard farmers' interests: Piyush GoyalUnion Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal said the India-US interim trade framework is a historic step toward achieving USD 500 billion in bilateral trade. He announced that reciprocal tariffs on Indian exports to the US will fall sharply from 50% to 18%.

Protection of farmers' interest in US deal surprised some: Govt's dig at OppositionPiyush Goyal dismissed criticism that the India-US trade deal would harm farmers and small producers, asserting that the interim framework fully safeguards their interests.

How India flipped the agri script on Trump? Piyush Goyal revealsUnion Minister Piyush Goyal stressed that India maintained its red lines on agriculture and dairy in its trade deal with the US, while opening its market selectively for certain items like wines and spirits.

What happens if the world's 10 richest people donate half their wealth?A trillion dollars from the world's richest may feel impossible, but pledges like Vedanta chairman Anil Agarwal's prove that big commitments are possible. Imagine what happens if the top ten step forward.

India–US trade deal: Decoding impact of lower 18% tariffs and duty-free boostIndian goods that were slammed with nearly 50% US tariffs last year will now face only 18%, and some key sectors even go duty-free. Here's how the interim pact changes the outlook for exporters.

India to buy $500 billion of US goods in 5 years as new trade deal cuts tariffsIndia's USD 500 billion buying plan will anchor the interim trade framework, as New Delhi will cut tariffs on US goods and Washington will lower duties on Indian exports to 18 per cent under the proposed bilateral pact.

18% tariff, wider US market access: How India gains from trade pact with USIndia and the US have finally agreed on a framework for an interim trade agreement. In this article, we break down what it means and why it matters for India.

Tariffs to fall, markets to open, lakhs of jobs: Piyush Goyal on India-US dealThe agreement will see the US cut reciprocal tariffs on Indian goods to 18 per cent and eliminate duties on products such as generic pharmaceuticals, gems and diamonds, and aircraft parts, boosting export opportunities across key sectors.

India, US unveil interim trade pact; cut tariffs, open $30 trillion marketThe India-US trade deal marks a reset in trade ties, cutting Trump tariffs to 18 per cent and setting the stage for a sweeping bilateral deal amid geopolitical recalibrations.

US stocks hit historic milestone as Dow crosses 50,000 points for first timeUS stocks surged Friday as tech shares rebounded and bitcoin steadied, pushing the S&P 500, Dow and Nasdaq sharply higher despite lingering worries over heavy AI spending and market volatility.

How Google rode the AI wave to cross $400 billion in annual revenue for 1st timeGoogle said that the Gemini app alone has crossed 750 million monthly active users, showing that AI adoption is no longer limited to developers or businesses.

Fractal Analytics, Aye Finance IPOs to open next week: What investors should knowInvestors will have two fresh IPO opportunities next week as Fractal Analytics and Aye Finance open their public issues on February 9. The offerings span technology and finance, drawing attention from those looking to diversify their portfolios.

Bitcoin crash stuns markets. Decoding biggest crypto slump since Trump electionBitcoin has witnessed one of its sharpest corrections in recent years, wiping out more than $2 trillion from the global cryptocurrency market in a single day. The fall is the steepest since Donald Trump's election. It comes amid rising global risk aversion, weakness in technology and AI stocks, and sustained institutional selling pressure.
Sensex, Nifty rebound to close higher; IT stocks bleed to limit gainsThe S&P BSE Sensex added 266.47 points to close at 83,580.40, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 50.90 points to end at 25,693.70.

Why Ola, Uber and Rapido drivers are going on a 6-hour strike todayThe strike has been called by the Telangana Gig and Platform Workers Union, also known as TGPWU. The union represents app-based transport workers operating on platforms such as Ola, Uber and Rapido.

Gold jumps Rs 1,000, silver falls Rs 6,000: Should you buy now or wait longer?Recent swings in gold and silver prices have caught investors' attention, with the metals showing mixed trends after a strong run. The big question now is whether this is a pause before the next move — should you buy now or wait longer?

Is Budget 2026 putting services at the centre of India's growth strategy?Budget 2026, in essence, quietly recognises that India's economic growth and job creation are and will continue to be powered by services – both tradable and non-tradable, while maintaining the focus on infrastructure and manufacturing.

entertainment.headline: Imran Khan says SRK, Salman, Aamir need to adapt as they age out of lead roles Imran Khan said that as actors grow older, they cannot continue playing traditional hero roles and must choose characters that suit their age. Speaking about Shah Rukh Khan, Salman Khan and Aamir Khan, he added that changing audience tastes are pushing stars to reinvent themselves.

No one wanted to work with me: Rhea Chakraborty talks about difficult career phase Rhea Chakraborty spoke about the painful years when she struggled to find acting opportunities and nearly gave up on her dream.

Vikrant Massey says he was never part of Ramayana, deletes clarification post later Vikrant Massey dismissed rumours of being part of Ranbir Kapoor's Ramayana, sharing a clarification on his Instagram Story that he later deleted. The actor criticised irresponsible media reports while maintaining he was never associated with the film.

Hanumankind on Arijit Singh stepping away from playback singing: Got to respect that Hanumankind has voiced support for Arijit Singh's decision to step away from playback singing, urging people to respect the singer's personal choice.

Akanksha Chamola hits back at trolls over dance videos, calls out double standards Akanksha Chamola has reacted to online trolling over her dance performances, saying loyalty in marriage is the bare minimum and that she is simply doing her job as an actor.

Dhurandhar afterthought: Why isn't there a great villain's role for Arjun Rampal? As Major Iqbal in Dhurandhar, Arjun Rampal aces the villain's act again, after Raajneeti and Om Shanti Om. Yet, Bollywood is still to create a memorable antagonist for the actor.

Mardaani 3 box office Day 9: Rani Mukerji's action drama surpasses Rs 30 crore mark Rani Mukerji's Mardaani 3 continues its steady box office run, crossing Rs 30 crore in India within nine days despite facing strong competition.

Brad Arnold, lead singer of 3 Doors Down, dies at 47 after cancer battle Brad Arnold, 47, lead singer of Grammy-nominated rock band 3 Doors Down, died after a battle with Stage 4 kidney cancer, months after revealing his diagnosis.

3rd rate actor from 3rd world country: Big B recalls old dig amid U19 World Cup win Amitabh Bachchan reflected on a foreign journalist's remark calling him a 'third-rate actor from a third-world country.' He shared the experience while celebrating India's sixth U19 World Cup victory.

So so sad: Manoj Bajpayee reacts to The Family Man 3 co-star Sunil Thapa's death Actor Manoj Bajpayee has expressed deep grief over the death of Sunil Thapa. In his latest Instagram post, he recalled the connection they shared while filming The Family Man 3.

Actress who said yes went off to America: Did Ektaa offer Naagin film to Priyanka? Ektaa Kapoor hinted an actor once said yes to her Naagin film but later left for America. Was it Priyanka Chopra? Here's what the producer revealed about the casting.

Priyanka Chopra mourns Sunil Thapa, recalls how he helped after her father's loss Actor Priyanka Chopra paid tribute to her Mary Kom co-actor Sunil Thapa, who died in Kathmandu after a cardiac arrest. The actor shared a heartfelt message recalling Thapa's support during her difficult times, especially after she lost her father.

Amid breakup rumours, Tara Sutaria says she's learned to protect her peace Actor Tara Sutaria said she has learned to protect her peace and prioritise calm amid public scrutiny. Her remarks come as breakup rumours with Veer Pahariya swirl, with neither confirming or denying the reports.

Akshay Kumar's Bhooth Bangla gets a new release date. Details inside The makers of Bhooth Bangla, starring Akshay Kumar and Tabu, have officially announced that the film will release in cinemas a month earlier than originally announced. The announcement was shared by Balaji Motion Pictures along with a promotional video.

Aneet Padda, Ahaan Panday's Saiyaara re-released in theatres? Here's what we know Mohit Suri's romantic drama Saiyaara was the biggest romantic film of 2025. Have the makers re-released the film in theatres in 2026 just ahead of Valentine's Day? Here's everything you need to know.

Amaal Mallik snaps at fan wars, wants to cancel song video with Farrhana Bhatt Music composer Amaal Mallik voiced concern over negativity among fan clubs following his collaboration announcement with Bigg Boss 19 co-contestant Farrhana Bhatt. He said the backlash has left him disturbed and hesitant to release his new song video.

Rupali Ganguly shares loved-up pics to celebrate 13 years of marriage with Ashwin Rupali Ganguly celebrated 13 years of marriage with husband Ashwin K. Verma by sharing romantic Maldives photos and a heartfelt note on social media.

AP Dhillon to debut his new track on The Great Indian Kapil Show. Details inside Punjabi singer AP Dhillon will perform his song 'Thinking of You' for the first time on Netflix's The Great Indian Kapil Show. He will be joined by comedian Anubhav Singh Bassi for a lively episode blending music and comedy.

Priyanka Chopra posts anniversary wish for brother Siddharth and wife Neelam. Video Priyanka Chopra celebrated her brother Siddharth Chopra and Neelam Upadhyaya's first wedding anniversary with a heartfelt video and message on social media.

general news.headline: If 1.25 crore Hindus decide to fight...: RSS chief's big remark on BangladeshSpeaking at an event in Mumbai to mark 100 years of the RSS, Mohan Bhagwat said that 1.25 crore Hindus in Bangladesh will get global Hindu support if they stay and fight for their rights amid rising violence against minorities.

Feels like Pakistan, not Dallas: Row over US lawmaker's Islamisation remarkRepublican Congressman Brandon Gill claimed parts of Dallas are undergoing 'Islamisation' due to 'mass Islamic migration,' comments that add to his history of anti-immigration remarks.

Did General Naravane do the right thing?Former Army Chief General MM Naravane wrote in his unpublished memoir that he was handed a "hot potato" by the NDA government during the confrontation with China along the LAC in August 2020. India's history of "hot potatoes" suggests a pattern. The political leadership gives nothing but broad brush outlines to military leaders, who then exercise their judgement.

Bangladesh, Pakistan bhai bhai: BCB head meets PCB head ahead of ICC meetingThe Bangladesh Cricket Board chief has flown to meet PCB boss Mohsin Naqvi. The visit comes right ahead of ICC crucial meeting with Pakistan over their boycott of match against India.

Dhurandhar afterthought: Why isn't there a great villain's role for Arjun Rampal?Handcrafted ByOur Editors As Major Iqbal in Dhurandhar, Arjun Rampal aces the villain's act again, after Raajneeti and Om Shanti Om. Yet, Bollywood is still to create a memorable antagonist for the actor.

After Ghaziabad sisters' deaths, father's 2015 live-in partner suicide resurfacesFrom a closed 2015 suicide case to three daughters' deaths, police are now piecing together a troubling timeline that may reveal what went wrong behind closed doors.

Delhi biker fell into pit. Official, passers-by saw. Why no help came for hoursTwenty-five-year-old Kamal Dhyani fell into a pit with his bike. Some saw it, but did not act. Police offered no meaningful help, his family claims. Negligence and indifference cost a young man his life.

Involves national security: Assam sends Gaurav Gogoi's 'Pak links' case to CentreAssam referring Pak link charges against Gaurav Gogoi to Union Home Ministry marks a sharp escalation in political confrontation between the ruling BJP and Congress ahead of assembly elections.

As T20 World Cup begins, Gen Z need to realise journalists are not cheerleadersJust days before the T20 World Cup, a familiar script played out online: outrage, accusation, erasure. This time, the target was not a player or an administrator, but a veteran journalist who asked a couple of inconvenient questions. So, at India Today, we tried to figure out: Has India's cricket discourse gone down the drain?

India likely to clear deal for 114 Rafale jets ahead of Macron's visitWith the air force down to 29 squadrons against a sanctioned 42, the defence council is set to consider clearing a Rs 3.25 lakh crore plan to acquire 114 Rafale fighter jets from France.

32nd Avenue CEO arrested in Rs 500-crore fraud, sold same unit to several buyersGurugram Police arrested Dhruv Dutt Sharma for allegedly selling the same commercial units to multiple investors, promising assured rentals and causing losses of around Rs 500 crore.

Holocaust slogans, bloody swastika: Teen's knife rampage at Russian universityA 15-year-old boy who attacked four Indian students at a medical college hostel in Russia, was reportedly linked to a banned neo-Nazi group.

I asked ChatGPT about my future. Its astrological predictions blew my mindHandcrafted ByOur Editors Astrology was once about planets and priests. Today, it's about prompts and predictions on ChatGPT. From questions about love life to picking interview outfits, and even forecasting job offers, people are turning to AI as their go-to astrologer. But, how accurate is it?

India agreed to open agriculture, dairy sectors to US players? Piyush Goyal answersEarlier, Piyush Goyal shared the details of the deal that followed a framework interim trade agreement between the two countries, aimed at boosting exports, jobs and market access. The trade deal will formally be signed in March.

US woman thanks Indians for the invention of dupattas. Video goes viralA US woman's video of her thanking Indians for inventing the dupatta triggered discussions on the growing global admiration for traditional Indian fashion.

India, Malaysia ink 6 key pacts, PM Modi talks up shared love for Tamil culturePrime Minister Narendra Modi chose Malaysia for his first foreign visit of 2026, strengthening the Comprehensive Strategic Partnership between India and Malaysia. The visit marked significant progress in economic, strategic, and people-to-people ties with multiple agreements exchanged.

Chatori Rajani on food, fame and the loss of her son that changed everythingChatori Rajani is best known for her Reels that begin with, "Aaj mere husband ke lunchbox mein kya hai." But behind the familiar line is a story of resilience and determination, one that many don't know, and one that deserves to be told.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Video: Terrifying moment when 'tsunami' swing snaps mid-air, crashes to groundA horrifying incident took place at the annual Surajkund Mela in Faridabad when a joyride collapsed there on Saturday. According to officials, a policeman died from injuries he sustained while trying to rescue people as the tragedy unfolded. They added that 12 other people were injured. The incident took place when a 'tsunami' swing snapped mid-air and came crashing on to the ground. Police Inspector Jagdish Prasad tried to save people when the joyride began tilting but suffered fatal injuries, officials said, according to news agency ANI. He was declared brought dead at the hospital.

What happened to Ranu Mondal after her overnight rise to fame?Ranu Mondal's story, in all probability, is nothing short of tragic - a visual representation of riches to rags, and a metaphoric proof of the fact that fame is but fleeting.

The Space Station will crash in 2030. Why it's actually good newsNasa plans to retire the ageing International Space Station in 2030 with a controlled crash into the Pacific Ocean. This move marks the beginning of a new era of commercial space travel and deep space missions.

No one wanted to work with me: Rhea Chakraborty talks about difficult career phaseRhea Chakraborty spoke about the painful years when she struggled to find acting opportunities and nearly gave up on her dream.

Washington Post publisher steps down days after sweeping layoffsThe Washington Post publisher and CEO Will Lewis stepped down days after announcing sweeping layoffs of over 300 journalists. He said that now is the right time for me to step aside.

The rise of anti-ambition: Why young workers are opting out of the career raceGen Z professionals in India are redefining ambition by prioritising emotional stability and flexibility. This shift challenges traditional career paths and urges employers to rethink motivation strategies.

sports.headline: Bangladesh, Pakistan bhai bhai: BCB head meets PCB head ahead of ICC meeting The Bangladesh Cricket Board chief has flown to meet PCB boss Mohsin Naqvi. The visit comes right ahead of ICC crucial meeting with Pakistan over their boycott of match against India.

Premier League: Carrick's United surge grows as Arsenal depth fuels title push Michael Carrick's early impact at Manchester United is reshaping belief, while Arsenal face title-defining weeks ahead. With pressure mounting across the table, this Premier League run-in is quickly becoming a manager's survival test.

Watch: Suryakumar Yadav makes fun Arshdeep batting promise after USA thriller Suryakumar Yadav and Arshdeep Singh shared a hilarious post-match moment after India's tense win over the USA. The skipper even jokingly promised Arshdeep a batting promotion following their late partnership.

Ranji Trophy plans worked in T20 World Cup: Siraj explains his heroics vs USA Mohammed Siraj credited his Ranji Trophy rhythm for his match-winning spell against the USA in India's T20 World Cup opener. Drafted in as a late replacement, Siraj stepped up instantly, taking three crucial wickets under pressure.

As T20 World Cup begins, Gen Z need to realise journalists are not cheerleaders Just days before the T20 World Cup, a familiar script played out online: outrage, accusation, erasure. This time, the target was not a player or an administrator, but a veteran journalist who asked a couple of inconvenient questions. So, at India Today, we tried to figure out: Has India's cricket discourse gone down the drain?

NZ vs AFG Live: Nabi removes Seifert to jolt Kiwis in 183 chase New Zealand (NZ) vs Afghanistan (AFG) Live Score, T20 World Cup 2026: NZ (120/3 in 12.3 ovs). Mohammad Nabi has taken the big wicket of Tim Seifert, who was threatening to take the match away from the Afghans. Daryl Mitchell has joined Mark Chapman in the middle.

Overhyped or not, Vaibhav silenced all critics with U19 World Cup final heroics At 14, most kids are worried about exams. Vaibhav Sooryavanshi was facing a nation's scrutiny after the Asia Cup final disappointment. His response? A staggering 175 in the U19 World Cup final.

Italy police fire tear gas, water cannon to break Winter Olympics protest Italian police fired tear gas and used water cannons on February 7 after Winter Olympics protests in Milan turned violent. Demonstrators rallied against environmental and social impacts before clashes erupted near an Olympic venue.

India boosted with return of Washington Sundar after USA scare ICC T20 World Cup: All-rounder Washington Sundar has recovered from his injury and is set to make a return to the team ahead of India's 2nd match in the T20 World Cup. Sundar was sidelined with a side strain and a rib muscle tear during India's ODI series against New Zealand.

USA thriller exposed key T20 World Cup lessons for India: Gavaskar lists solutions Sunil Gavaskar believes India's win over the USA exposed key T20 World Cup lessons despite the 30-run margin. He warned that early collapses and sloppy powerplays could hurt India against stronger teams.

Pakistan didn't win, we lost against ourselves: Netherlands' pacer Paul Van Meekeren Netherlands pacer Paul van Meekeren said his team lost against themselves in their narrow T20 World Cup defeat to Pakistan. The Dutch quick rued missed chances that could have potentially ended Pakistan's campaign early.

Can Wirtz-Ekitike fire Liverpool past City in season-defining clash?Premier League: A blockbuster showdown awaits at Anfield on Sunday as Arne Slot's Liverpool welcome Pep Guardiola's Manchester City. While the two sides are not locked in a head-to-head title race as they have been in recent seasons, the fixture is still packed with intrigue, and the outcome could have far-reaching consequences for the rest of the campaign.

At Wankhede, Mathemagician Suryakumar Yadav solves India's T20 World Cup problemT20 World Cup 2026: Suryakumar Yadav turned chaos into calculus against the USA. Scoops, sweeps, redefined angles, and resolve indicate he is ready to solve his legacy problem

Matchday Preview: Giant slayers AFG take on NZ as ENG, SL kick off campaignsT20 World Cup 2026, Matchday preview: The Day 2 of the T20 World Cup 2026 features three thrilling matches with Afghanistan taking on New Zealand and England and Sri Lanka also starting their respective campaigns. Spin-friendly pitches could play a crucial role, setting up intriguing contests and possible upsets. Here's our match-wise guide for Day 2 of the tournament:

How Siraj cancelled plans to watch Real Madrid after shock T20 World Cup call-upT20 World Cup: Mohammed Siraj had Real Madrid tickets booked for February 15th. Then came Suryakumar Yadav's call 24 hours before the World Cup opener. The pacer delivered three wickets on his dramatic return.

Agni, son of Vidhu Vinod Chopra, dismisses 'fake' reports linking him to PSL auctionAgni Dev Chopra, son of filmmaker Vidhu Vinod Chopra and film critic Anupama Chopra, has dismissed reports linking him to the Pakistan Super League (PSL) 2026 auction as "fake and misleading".

Shubman Gill enjoys Man United's win vs Spurs during India's T20 WC openerIndia's Test and ODI captain Shubman Gill was spotted in Paris watching Manchester United beat Tottenham 2-0 while his T20 teammates scraped past the USA in their World Cup opener at Mumbai's Wankhede.

Don't joke: When Siraj mistook Surya's T20 World Cup phone call for a prankSenior India pacer Mohammed Siraj revealed that he initially thought captain Suryakumar Yadav was playing a prank when he received a call informing him of his selection as Harshit Rana's replacement in India's updated squad for the ongoing ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2026.

How Gambhir helped Suryakumar keep calm under pressure vs USA? Batter revealsIndia captain Suryakumar Yadav played a brilliant unbeaten 84 to guide India to a 29-run win against the USA. Gautam Gambhir's calming advice helped Yadav handle pressure and steer India to victory.

T20 World Cup: Suryakumar special helps India avoid opening-day gloom vs USAT20 World Cup: Skipper Suryakumar Yadav's special unbeaten 84 helped India avoid opening-day gloom as the defending champions began their title defence with a nervy 29-run win over the USA at Mumbai's Wankhede Stadium on Saturday, February 7.

Kolkata's Eden debunks attendance fears, turns up for Scotland vs West IndiesKolkata's Eden Gardens brushed aside attendance concerns after Bangladesh pulled out of the T20 World Cup 2026, citing security issues, with Scotland stepping in to face the West Indies in their season opener.

Mohammad Kaif's blunt live-TV take on Babar Azam goes viralPakistan secured a narrow three-wicket win over the Netherlands in their T20 World Cup opener. Babar Azam's slow batting tempo has sparked intense debate about his role in the modern T20 format.

Who is Shadley van Schalkwyk? USA pacer stuns India with three wickets in one overUSA pacer Shadley van Schalkwyk produced a sensational spell to stun India on Saturday, claiming three wickets in a single over during their ICC T20 World Cup clash and leaving the defending champions in early disarray.

Rohit Sharma chants echo at Wankhede during T20 World Cup opening ceremonyT20 World Cup 2026: Rohit Sharma, the tournament ambassador, brought the T20 World Cup onto the field of play ahead of India's opening match against the USA. The Wankhede Stadium cheered for the local hero, who led India to triumph in 2024.

ICC T20 World Cup 2026: 300 hopes up in smoke as USA rattle India in powerplayICC T20 World Cup: Defending champions India endured a nightmare start in the batting powerplay against the USA in their tournament-opener with the top-order having a rare off day.

IND vs USA: Sanju Samson dropped, Jasprit Bumrah rested due to illnessT20 World Cup 2026: India dropped Sanju Samson from the XI to accommodate in-form Ishan Kishan for their opening match against the USA in Mumbai on Saturday. Mohammed Siraj, who replaced injured Harshit Rana, got a game straightaway after Jasprit Bumrah missed out due to illness.

T20 World Cup: Shepherd hat-trick, Hetmyer blitz power West Indies past ScotlandICC T20 World Cup: Romario Shepherd's hat-trick and Shimron Hetmyer's fighting fifty helped West Indies begin their campaign with a 35-run win over Scotland at Kolkata's Eden Gardens on Saturday.

T20 World Cup: England name playing XI for opening game vs Nepal, drop Ben DuckettEngland have announced their playing XI for the opening game of the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2026, making a key change by dropping Ben Duckett. Captain Harry Brook faces scrutiny after a disciplinary incident, but the team remains confident ahead of the tournament.

India vs Pakistan match still on? Pak board, ICC in talks over boycott threatT20 World Cup 2026: The Pakistan Cricket Board has agreed to engage in further dialogue with the International Cricket Council after the global body questioned the Force Majeure clause invoked to justify boycotting the February 15 match against India in Colombo.

Rahmanullah Gurbaz pulls out of PSL days after joining Peshawar ZalmiAfghanistan wicketkeeper-batter Rahmanullah Gurbaz has opted out of the Pakistan Super League (PSL) 2026, after fellow Afghanistan international Naveen-ul-Haq earlier posted a cryptic message on Facebook.

New Zealand couldn't have had better T20 World Cup preps than playing India: Mitchell SantnerT20 World Cup 2026, NZ vs AFG: Speaking to the reporters before the clash against Afghanistan on Sunday, Mitchell Santner said that New Zealand couldn't have hoped for better preparations than playing a series against India. Before the mega event, the Kiwis played a bilateral series where India beat them 4-1.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
